io.github.thunderbots.lightning.control

Class JoystickMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.control.JoystickMonitor

  • public class JoystickMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
    A JoystickMonitor is an object that attaches to a specific joystick object, and monitors any changes in the joystick inputs. Any detected changes are forwarded to the objects that are listening to the specific joystick.

    Objects that should listen to the joysticks should register themselves with the appropriate JoystickMonitor.

    Author:
    Zach Ohara, Pranav Mathur

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  JoystickMonitor.MonitorUpdateRunnable
      The MonitorUpdateRunnable class is run through the task scheduler, and is used to continuously check the joystick for any changes.

      The map of all the appropriate methods to the specific objects that contain them.

      The joystick to monitor.
      private java.util.List<JoystickButton> lastButtons
      The latest 'snapshot' of the buttons on the gamepad.

      • joystick

      • handlers

        private java.util.Map<JoystickButton,java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Method>> handlers
        The Methods that are called when buttons specified in the ButtonHandler annotation are updated.

      • instances

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.reflect.Method,JoystickListener> instances
        The map of all the appropriate methods to the specific objects that contain them.

      • lastButtons

        private java.util.List<JoystickButton> lastButtons
        The latest 'snapshot' of the buttons on the gamepad. The list contains every button on the joystick that is pressed, in no specific order.
